title: Enhancing waste resource efficiency: circular economy for sustainability and energy conversion - Frontiers
summary: This article explores the Circular Economy (CE) framework's application in optimizing waste resource efficiency. It emphasizes the concept's extension of product life cycles while minimizing waste, focusing on the conversion of waste into biogas and incineration for energy production. The article analyzes the case study of the Orli Staw municipal waste treatment facility in Poland, highlighting its successful transformation of biowaste into biogas, demonstrating the potential for energy self-sufficiency within CE principles.
official_company_name: Zakład Utylizacji Odpadów Komunalnych Orli Staw

title: Recent NSF Awards in Design for Environmental Sustainability in Computing Are Advancing US National Priorities - National Science Foundation
summary: The U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) has awarded $13M to 25 research teams through its Design for Environmental Sustainability in Computing (DESC) program to develop innovations in computing that reduce environmental impact. These projects include reducing greenhouse gas emissions from data centers, extending the lifespan of computer systems, and developing eco-friendly computing materials. The DESC program aims to promote research and development that integrates environmental considerations into computing technologies, contributing to a sustainable future.
product_or_process: various innovations in computer systems and their design and manufacturing processes

title: Intelligent OTN Solution: Enabling Fast and Simplified Deployment of Self-Healing Networks - ZTE
summary: ZTE has developed an intelligent OTN solution that integrates network management and control with WASON, enabling end-to-end management and control. The solution also includes automatic power optimization (APO) and flexible grids, which improve network efficiency and reduce costs. By automating processes, ZTE's intelligent OTN solution aims to simplify network deployment, enhance self-healing capabilities, and promote network scalability.

title: From gadget to garbage - newagebd.net
summary: Bangladesh faces a mounting e-waste crisis, generating 2.7 million tonnes annually, with the potential to double by 2030.  The article highlights the environmental, health, and climate change impacts of improper e-waste disposal, along with the lack of infrastructure and regulations to manage it.  Solutions proposed include a data-driven approach, extended producer responsibility schemes, investing in recycling facilities, and raising consumer awareness.

title: Cenviro's Contribution To Circular Economy in Advancing Malaysia - The Edge Malaysia
summary: Cenviro, a Malaysian waste management company, is shifting its focus towards a circular economy model by increasing recycling and recovery efforts. The company has implemented various green initiatives, such as a waste-to-energy plant and a Vertical Secured Landfill, to reduce waste and promote sustainability. Cenviro is also expanding its operations regionally and plans to invest in new recycling technologies, aiming to become a modern resource company.
